title: Module System for Large-Scale Rule Organization
v1.0.0-alpha - Backward Chaining (Goal-Driven Reasoning)
body:
**Backward Chaining (Goal-Driven Reasoning)** - Query-driven inference engine! ⚠️ **ALPHA VERSION**

> **⚠️ ALPHA STATUS**: Backward chaining is currently in **alpha stage** and **NOT production-ready**. The implementation is incomplete and should be used for **experimentation and feedback only**. Production use is not recommended at this time.

- **🎯 Goal-Driven Reasoning** - Start from a goal and work backwards to prove it (partial implementation)
- **🔍 Query Language** - GRL query syntax with compound goals (&&, !=)
- **📊 Search Strategies** - Depth-first, breadth-first, and iterative deepening (basic support)
- **🎓 Expert Systems** - Perfect for diagnosis, decision trees, and classification (experimental)
- **✅ Hybrid Mode** - Combine forward and backward chaining for best results
- **🔄 Proof Traces** - Full explanation of why goals are provable or not (in development)
- **📝 GRL Integration** - Query definitions in `.grl` files alongside rules

title: Multi-field Variables feature
body:
🎉 Multi-field Variables feature highlight
9 operations showcased (Collect, Contains, Count, First, Last, Index, Slice, IsEmpty, NotEmpty)
GRL syntax examples (BulkDiscount, CategorizeElectronics, EmptyCart, ProcessFirstTask rules)
Template definition example with multislot_field()
Complete operations comparison table (GRL vs CLIPS syntax)
Links to example files

title: 0.11.1 benches
body:
Benchmark Results Summary
The 1 million rules benchmark has been successfully completed! Here are the key results:

📊 Performance Metrics
Rule Creation: 1,000,000 rules created in ~800ms
Execution Performance: 1,200,133 rules/second
Latency: 0.83 µs per rule
Average Execution Time: ~833ms per run
Memory Usage: ~500MB (estimated)
✅ Key Achievements
Successfully scaled from 2,000 to 1,000,000 rules (500x increase)
Fixed compilation errors and duplicate code issues
Proper benchmark structure converted from Criterion to standalone binary
Accurate memory reporting (corrected from incorrect GB display)
Enterprise-scale validation - RETE-UL handles massive rule sets effectively
🚀 RETE-UL Performance Assessment
The results demonstrate that RETE-UL performs excellently at enterprise scale:

Real-time capable: Sub-second execution for batch processing
Memory efficient: ~500MB for 1M rules (reasonable for server environments)
High throughput: Over 1 million rules/second processing rate

📚 Update README for v0.8.0 - fix syntax errors and add workflow engine

✅ Features Updated:
- 🌊 Added Workflow Engine v0.8.0 documentation with examples
- 🚨 Updated Action Handlers v0.7.1 with corrected syntax
- 🔧 Fixed parameter syntax: positional args instead of named params
- 📝 Corrected all code examples to use {:?} for Value display
- 🎯 Updated version numbers from 0.6.0 → 0.8.0
- ✅ Verified all examples work correctly

🧪 Testing Status:
- ✅ All 47 tests pass (39 unit + 5 integration + 3 doc)
- ✅ Workflow Engine demo works perfectly
- ✅ Action Handlers demo with GRL files works
- ✅ Pattern Matching (EXISTS/NOT/FORALL) works
- ✅ Rule Attributes (agenda groups, etc.) work
- ✅ RuleEngineBuilder API works as documented

📋 Changes Made:
- Fixed SendEmail syntax from named params to positional
- Added comprehensive workflow examples
- Updated feature list and changelog
- Corrected all README code examples
- Ensured 100% accuracy between docs and implementation

title: V0.5.0
body:
🚀 Release v0.5.0: AI Integration & Enhanced Rule Engine

✨ Major Features:
- AI integration with OpenAI, Anthropic, and Hugging Face APIs
- Real-world AI examples for production use
- Enhanced GRL parser with improved syntax support
- Performance optimizations and bug fixes

🤖 AI Integration:
- Real AI API integration examples
- Production-ready AI service patterns
- AI-powered rule execution scenarios
- Async/sync compatibility for AI calls

🔧 Improvements:
- Fixed clippy linting issues
- Cleaned up debug files and unused code
- Enhanced parser for complex rule conditions
- Updated documentation and examples

📦 Package:
- Published to crates.io as rust-rule-engine v0.5.0
- 39 working examples included
- Full test coverage maintained
- Ready for production use

🧪 Testing:
- All 20 unit tests passing
- 5 integration tests passing  
- 3 doc tests passing
- Examples compile and run successfully
